location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

physicalDescription.extent: Materials: Printed in colour on paper.Dimensions: 656 x 861mm, on sheet 753 x 984mm.

mods.abstract: Map depicting the south-eastern tip of the Arabian Peninsula. The map indicates hydrology and settlements, as well as providing some indication of relief in the form of hachures. A table of symbols appears on the map.Originally published in 1910 by the Surveyor General of India, with additions in 1916. Reprinted with minor additions and corrections by the War Office's Geographical Section, General Staff, in 1930 (this copy is dated February 1932).
